div1.p: Lazear discusses Sweitzer's visit to the Boston area and her visit with Mabel Lazear's mother, Martha Houston.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 5, [1897]
div1.p:
Your letter
of Sep. 1 came on
Friday. I think it
will be very nice to
spend a week in
Beverly. Mrs Houston
will take a great
deal of pleasure in
showing you the
points of interest.

Be sure to make them
take a drive down
to Beverly Farms and
Manchester. You
can go by the Trolley
to Marblehead and
Gloucester. Salem
as a whole is ugly
but there are many
very pretty houses.

Notice the doors and
doorways in particular

I have never seen prettier ones
anywhere. Mrs. Houston will
want to show you the museums
but they are all stupid.

Be sure to dress warmly at
Beverly.

I enclose a letter which
came yesterday.
